main event: An unidentified round, orange-red object observed in the sky over Olympic National Park, Washington, on 15 October 1958.
interesting points: The object appeared to brighten and dim,It was estimated to be twice the size of neighboring stars,The observation lasted while the object remained stationary,Possible investigation indicated the object might have been the star Capella,The visibility conditions were clear during the observation.
witness description: The observer was a 37-year-old electric welder from Bremerton, Washington.
